GSILib.connect.client

Class RMIClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • GSILib.connect.client.RMIClient

  • public class RMIClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a RMI client as general in order to be able to use with any registry. It makes it possible returning a remote object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RMIClient()
      Empty class constructor
      RMIClient(java.lang.String remoteMachine, int port, java.lang.String tag)
      This constructor creates a RMI session for a client

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      This method allows to establish a generic RMI session (without tag, using default port)

      This method allows to establish a generic RMI session (without tag)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RMIClient

        public RMIClient()
        Empty class constructor

      • RMIClient

        public RMIClient(java.lang.String remoteMachine,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String tag)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This constructor creates a RMI session for a client
        Parameters:
        remoteMachine - Address for the remote machine
        port - Connection port
        tag - Tag for the desired client stub
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - handles errors on RMI session creation

    • Method Detail

      • conect

        public boolean conect(java.lang.String remoteMachine,
                      int port)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method allows to establish a generic RMI session (without tag)
        Parameters:
        remoteMachine - Address for the remote machine
        port - Connection port
        Returns:
        True if connection made correctly, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - handles errors associated with RMI

      • conect

        public boolean conect(java.lang.String remoteMachine)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method allows to establish a generic RMI session (without tag, using default port)
        Parameters:
        remoteMachine - Address for the remote machine
        Returns:
        True if connection made correctly, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - handles errors associated with RMI

      • lookup

        public java.rmi.Remote lookup(java.lang.String tag)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method ensures the correct selection of the tag
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag for the desired client stub
        Returns:
        A new remote object with you can use as a client.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - will handle errors related to bad tag selection
